perturbation.original_text: For purposes of determining Affiliate’s Commission, an “Approved Account” means any Chase credit card application that is: (i) submitted by any user who clicks on an e-mail, banner or any other advertising material from Affiliate’s Website; (ii) is approved by Chase; and (iii) is reported as approved by Chase to Affiliate.
perturbation.changed_text: For purposes of determining Affiliate’s Commission, an “Approved Account” means any Chase credit card application that is: (i) submitted by any user who clicks on an e-mail, banner or any other advertising material from Affiliate’s Website; (ii) is approved by Chase; and (iii) the applicant has made at least one purchase using the credit card within 90 days of approval.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Approved Account' only requires application approval and reporting. The modified version adds a condition that the applicant must also make a purchase within 90 days. This creates conflicting criteria for defining an 'Approved Account,' causing ambiguity and disputes over commission payments.

perturbation.original_text: Affiliate may select or remove Links, at any time without prior approval from Chase.
perturbation.changed_text: Affiliate may select or remove Links, at any time without prior approval from Chase. However, all removed links must be replaced with alternative links approved by Chase within 72 hours or the affiliate will be in breach of contract.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction. The original text allows the affiliate to remove links without approval. The modified text adds a new requirement: all removed links need to be replaced with approved links within a specific timeframe. This creates ambiguity regarding the affiliate's freedom to manage links and introduces a condition of breach.

perturbation.original_text: Affiliates who use this program to apply for credit cards for their own use are NOT in violation of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Affiliates who use this program to apply for credit cards for their own use are NOT in violation of this Agreement, provided that such use does not exceed one application per quarter. Any affiliate exceeding this limit will be subject to a reduced commission rate on all accounts.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that affiliates applying for their own cards are not in violation of the agreement. The modified text adds a limit of one application per quarter, introducing a contradictory restriction. This ambiguity could lead to disputes over commission rates and the definition of 'acceptable use.'
